lead_paragraph: When Sante and Kenneth Kimes -- the hand-holding, mother-and-son grifter team -- were sentenced to 125 years in June, it seemed like the end of a surreal string of crimes that culminated in the murder of an elderly Upper East Side socialite. But yesterday, during a prison interview, Mr. Kimes took a Court TV reporter hostage for four hours, holding a pen to her neck. Mr. Kimes, 25, was being interviewed by Maria Zone, 35, a freelance producer for the documentary series ''Crime Stories,'' at the Clinton Correctional Facility in upstate New York.
abstract: Kenneth Kimes, who along with his mother Sante was sentenced to 125 years in June for string of crimes that culminated in murder of elderly Upper East Side socialite Irene Silverman, takes Court TV reporter Maria Zone hostage for four hours by holding pen to her neck before being restrained by correction officers; Kimes was being interviewed by Zone for documentary series Crime Stories at Clinton Correctional Facility in upstate New York; Kimes's main demand was that his mother not be extradited to California where they face death penalty for murder of business associate; photo (M)

headline.main: Kenneth Kimes Takes Reporter As a Hostage
